mcq.prompt:
Under the Architects Act(Cap. 12), which of the following is/are true? 
i) An architect shall not act as an architect for his own house. 
ii) An architect may exhibit his name on a building which is being constructed, altered or extended, in relation to which he is rendering architectural services 
iii) An architect may sign on buildings which have been designed by him. 
iv) An architect shall not accept a commission or engagement to render architectural services for a client while a claim for outstanding fees by another architect remains unsatisfied.

Which of the following is/are considered ABC water design features? 
i) Bio-retention Swales 
ii) Planter Boxes 
iii) Pumped Discharge Detention Tanks 
iv) Porous Pavements

Which of the following statements with regards to URA's GFA Apportionment Rules for Common Areas in Mixed Use Development are true? 
i) Attributable space referes to a space which is exclusively used for a specific purpose. The GFA will be apportioned to the specific use. 
ii) The GFA of a common area where it is not exclusively used for a specific purpose, shall be apportioned based on the weighted average, pegged to the prescribed use quantum mix in the Masterplan. 
For White site developments with multiple proposed use, the non-attributable common areas will be apportioned based on a simple avereage of the uses in the development.
mcq.explanation: All is true, refer to DC circular of GFA Apportionment. https://www.ura.gov.sg/Corporate/Guidelines/Circulars/dc15-07

mcq.prompt:
Under the Fire Code 2013, all floors in a building including the roof level shall be considered as habitable floors. The roof level can be considered as non-habitable if it is not used for any purpose other than housing M&E equipment/plants. 

Which of the following can be housed on a non-habitable roof? 
i) Lift motors 
ii) Photovoltaic panels 
iii) Cooling towers 
iv) Back-up generators

Which of the following statements are true to the Workplace Safety and Health (Design for Safety) Regulations 2015? 
i) The Regulations is only applicable to all projects with contract sum of $10 million or more. 
ii) The developer is able to delegate his Developer's Duties to a DFS professional. However, the developer is still responsible for the DFS professional's performance. 
iii) The designer shall not produce designs that cannot be constructed, maintained, used or demolished in a reasonably safe manner. 
The contractor is required to inform the person who appointed him of any foreseeable design risk that the structure poses to ensure that the project is carried out without risks to safety or health of any person who may be affected by it.

Which of the following is true? 
For construction work on or after 1st September 2011:
mcq.optionA: No work is allowed from 10.00pm on Saturday/eve of Public Holiday to 10.00am on Sunday/Public Holiday.
mcq.optionB: No work allowed from 7.00pm on Saturday/eve of Public Holiday to 7.00am on Sunday/Public Holiday.
mcq.optionC: No work allowed from 10.00pm on Saturday/eve of Public Holiday to 7.00am on the following Monday/day after the Public Holiday.
mcq.optionD: No work allowed from 7.00pm on Saturday/eve of Public Holiday to 10.00am on Sunday/Public Holiday.

https://www.nea.gov.sg/our-services/pollution-control/noise-pollution/construction-noise-control 
After 10pm on Sat/eve of PH to 7am on the following Monday/day after PH

mcq.prompt:
A licensed housing developer shall deposit any instalments of purchase money and/or loan for the construction of a building project into the Project Account of the building project. 
A certificate from the Qualified Person in charge of the building project is required for the release of payment for which following works: 
i) Foundation works 
ii) Soil investigation 
Earth works 
iv) Cable detection works
mcq.explanation: Housing Developer Act. Cable detection works not included

mcq.prompt:
In complying with the BCA's requirements on daylight reflectance of building facade materials, which of the following is/are deemed acceptable? 
i) The glass for the building work has a daylight reflectance not exceeding 20% 
ii) The roof, inclined at angle 10 degrees from the horizontal plane of the building has a specular reflectance not exceeding 10% 
iii) The roof, inclined at angle of more than 20 degrees from the horizontal plane of the building has a daylight reflectance not exceeding 20% and a specular reflectance not exceeding 10% 
iv) Emulsion paint on a plastered or concrete surfaces which has a specular reflectance not exceeding 10%
mcq.explanation:
BCA Approved Solution P.3. 
All are true.

mcq.prompt: Which of the statements with regard to SCDF's requirements for persons with disabilities (PWD) in an A&A work is true?
mcq.optionA: A PWD Holding point shall be provided for an A&A works affecting the common corridor of a building under a single ownership in a non-strata title building.
mcq.optionB: Industrial buildings that are exempted from barrier-free accessibility compliance under the BCA's Code of Accessibility in the Built Environment will still need to comply to PWD requirements.
mcq.optionC: Where an alteration work to a building affects smoke stop lobby, a PWD Holding Point and Distress communication means shall be incorporated to the affected floor.
mcq.optionD: The provision of visual alarm system is not applicable to health care buildings that are exempted from PWD requirements.

mcq.prompt:
Under the Housing Developers (Control and Licensing) Act, which of the followings is/are true? 
On completion of a title survey, if the deficiency is more than 3% of the area stated in the Agreement, the Purchasing Price shall be reduced. 
ii) On completion of a title survey, if the area of the Property is more than the area stated in the Agreement, the Purchasing Price shall be adjusted. 
iii) The Purchaser shall pay for the changes to Specifications or approved plans if such changes are required by the Commissioner of Building Control or other relevant authorities. 
iv) For any changes involving the substitution or use of cheaper materials or an omission of works as originally stated in the Specifications or approved plans, the Purchaser shall be entitled to a corresponding reduction in Purchasing Price.
